I hope the pressures of ApacheCon didn't render you
idempotent for the holidays. ;-)

I noticed that while idempotence seems an important
distinguishing property of some HTTP methods, it's not
mentioned at all in REST.  Or did I miss it?

Walden


----- Original Message -----
From: "Roy T. Fielding" <fielding@...>
To: <rest-discuss@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, January 23, 2003 11:51 AM
Subject: Re: [rest-discuss] Nifty REST T-Shirts


> Good grief.  Why does everyone equate REST with HTTP?  REST apps work
> quite well with file, ftp, gopher, wais, urn, ...
>
> I won't even mention waka in that list because it isn't done yet.
> [Sorry, I got engaged the weekend before I gave the waka talk at
> ApacheCon and wasn't prepared for the effect that has on work over
> the holidays.]
>
> ....Roy
